intro: Streptanthus morrisonii subsp. kruckebergii, commonly known as the Kruckeberg's fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of the United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, showy flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces elongated, lantern-shaped fruits that contain several seeds. Its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements make it a rare and ecologically significant species.
